anchorRight.long: Place the primary frontline on the safer lane to stabilize early tempo and avoid multi-angle pressure.

pressureLeft.long: Front-left typically absorbs pressure from multiple enemies. Use durable tanks or control anchors here.

collapseMelee.long: Multiple melee heroes stack AoE pressure and crowd control chains to dominate clustered fights.

engineCore.long: Energy push, cooldown reduction and haste accelerate carry conversion cycles.

tempoDoubleCarry.long: Tempo engines accelerate ultimate rotations, enabling repeated burst windows and fast carry conversion.

controlChain.long: Layered control denies enemy tempo and locks priority targets during engage windows.

frontlineSustain.long: Stable frontline combined with sustain wins extended engagements through consistency.

burstWindow.long: Play around decisive engage windows and eliminate high-value targets quickly.

collapsePressure.long: Force enemies into tight spaces and overwhelm them with stacked AoE damage.

balancedScaling.long: Maintain tempo parity early and convert mid-game advantages into controlled victories.

controlCollapse.long: Force enemies into tight spaces and overwhelm them with stacked AoE damage.

burstWindows.long: Play around decisive engage windows and eliminate high-value targets quickly.

noFrontline.long: Lack of a true anchor makes the team vulnerable to early collapse or extended engagements.

singleFrontlinePvp.long: Only one frontline unit increases vulnerability against coordinated PvP dive setups.

tempoNoConversion.long: Energy acceleration without enough burst or scaling carries leads to wasted tempo.

lowSustain.long: If the initial burst window fails, the team may struggle in prolonged fights.

delayedNoAnchor.long: Delayed engage heroes require stable anchors — otherwise tempo collapses before impact.

ccVulnerable.long: Heavy enemy crowd control can lock key heroes before tempo engines activate.

generic.long: Avoid giving the enemy an uncontested first engage and respect pressure lanes.

delayedDiveNoAnchor.long: Delayed engage heroes require stable anchors — otherwise tempo collapses before impact.

strong.slowScaling: Excels against teams that rely on delayed scaling without early tempo tools.
strong.lowCleanse: Control chains gain maximum value against teams lacking reliable cleanse tools.
strong.poke: Sustain + collapse pressure neutralizes slow attrition compositions.
strong.fragileBackline: Fast engage and dive tools eliminate exposed backline carries quickly.
strong.dive: Frontline clustering and AoE control punish reckless dive assassins.
strong.pokeAttrition: Sustain + collapse pressure neutralizes slow attrition compositions.
strong.diveAssassins: Frontline clustering and AoE control punish reckless dive assassins.

weak.heavyCC: Lockdown compositions can interrupt carry conversion cycles.
weak.stall: High-tank stall setups waste tempo windows and extend fights unfavorably.
weak.assassinFocus: Backline carries may fall quickly against high-burst assassin comps.
